name: Extension
title: CS Extension
notes:
**Note 1**: In the United States and Canada, Kaposisarcoma is usually an illness related to Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS) which affects primarily the skin; however, lesions may also form in the connective tissue, mucosa (e.g. oral cavity) or visceral organs (e.g. lungs).  For connective tissue tumors (C49._), use extension codes for skin.

**Note 2**:  Choice of CS Extension codes for Kaposi sarcoma depends on number and location of lesions.  For example, use code 110 for a single lesion involving skin; use code 210 for multiple lesions involving skin.  Use code 250 for any number of lesions involving both skin and viscera.
rows:
Single lesion:
    Skin and/or connective tissue

Single lesion: 
    Mucosa (e.g., oral cavity, anus, rectum, vagina, vulva)

Single lesion:
    Viscera (e.g., pulmonary, gastrointestinal tract, spleen, other)

Multiple lesions:
    Skin and/or connective tissue

Multiple lesions:
    Mucosa (e.g., oral cavity, anus, rectum, vagina, vulva)

Multiple lesions:
    Viscera (e.g., pulmonary, gastrointestinal tract, spleen, other)

(120 or 220) + (110 or 210)

Multiple lesions, mucosa plus skin and/or connective tissue

(130 or 230) + (110 or 210)

Multiple lesions, viscera plus skin and/or connective tissue

(130 or 230) + (120 or 220)

Multiple lesions, viscera plus mucosa

(130 or 230) + (120 or 220) + (110 or 210)

Multiple lesions, visceral plus mucosa plus skin and/or connective tissue

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed 
Not documented in patient record
